title: Ticket #12: condor_status always prints a tailing \n to stdout
description:
it means you always have to strip the empty line...

$ condor_status -const 'State=="Claimed"' -format '%s\n' ClientMachine | sort | uniq -c 1 ... 11 suzy.cs.wisc.edu

i believe this comes from condor_status.V6/prettyPrint.C:162

is there a reason the 'printf ("\n");' is there? the line has been there since raman first checked in condor_status.V6.

i'd propose removing it if there is no good reason.
remarks:
2009-Jul-30 16:11:37 by psilord:
Wow, 6 months to remove a printf! That's hilarious!

2009-Jul-30 16:13:38 by matt:
The "no comments" timer finally fired.
